page.title: 11EDUCATION IN NANTGLYN.
page.content: The present building has been a school since 1859.Earlier the balcony of St. James' Church was the classroom where Twm o'r Nant attended.This colourful 18c. character wrote Welsh morality plays known as Interludes. There are 38 pupils in 2 classes and all lessons are conducted in Welsh.At 11 most transfer to the Welsh medium school, Ysgol Glan Clwyd, St. Asaph 12 miles away. There is a special school bus for them. All the children like their school as shown on the survey on page 12. Over the last 10 years many English people have come to Nantglyn, and 11 of the 24 families represented in the school are English speaking. The school can still retain its totally Welsh approach and it is supported in this by the parents.
